title: Labor of Love: 5 Last-Minute Holiday Weekend Ideas
text:
Labor of Love: 5 Last-Minute Holiday Weekend Ideas 
Photo: Shutterstock 
By Chris Bunting 
Tremendous news: If you’re one of the 93 million Americans currently unemployed (as Trump’s abacus tells us, anyway), you still have one day to find a job to justify all that nonworking, day drinking, and frankfurter-inhaling you’ll be guilty of this nearing Labor Day weekend. 
It doesn’t even have to be a particularly good job, either, given all the last-minute getaway packages still out there on the table. 
From places that need day-offing the most (NYC metro) to those who pretty much make Labor Day every day (Puerto Rico, bankruptcy becomes it), the end of summer marks the start of shoulder-season rates. 
So come, worship at our Church of Cheap-ish Prices of Labor Day Saints. We have five on tap! 
Cheeca Lodge & Spa , Florida Keys, Fla. 
Photo: Handout 
Host your own hybrid Conch Republic secession/Labor Day party at Islamorada’s heavily palm-fronded resort through Monday, where rooms start at just $199 per night. They’ll throw in free meals and dessert for children under 12 with each purchase of an adult entree, $100 credit for water sports or Camp Cheeca, and other gift shop vouchers. 
Hilton Anatole , Dallas, Texas 
Photo: Handout 
Running back DeMarco Murray left some kinda void when he ditched the Cowboys and set sail for Philly, giving you the perfect excuse to bunker down at the Anatole while you try out for his former job. The hotel’s Stay & See Dallas offer, starting at $194 a night over Labor Day weekend, includes room, daily breakfast, Wi-Fi and in-room movie with snackage for up to four guests. It’s an average nightly savings of $100. 
Copamarina Beach Resort & Spa , Guanica, Puerto Rico 
Photo: Handout 
The highlights of this lush, southern resort (a healthy two-hour drive from SJ’s cray cray) include crash-ready hammocks, day-trippy boat rides, outdoor movie nights (with popcorn), s’mores tastings and a giant Kraken-looking tree. But over Labor Day, it’s the rate that shines: just $175 per night, with daily breakfast for two, a 25 percent-off discount on water sports rentals and spa treatments, and 15 percent off at Las Palmas Café. 
The InterContinental Toronto Centre , Canada 
Photo: Handout 
We all know you’re married to America — but your Ashley Madison “friend” will forever be Canada. Not only can you score a 25 percent bump cashing dollars into loonies, but once you land, the whole city will also throw itself at you for free: An outdoor moving screening at the Harbourfront Centre; Artfest (Sept. 4-7); Distillery Sunday Market (Sept. 6); the newly opened 15,000-square-foot Toronto Island labyrinth. Yes, all of the above = free. Top it all off by booking the family-fun Time Out in T.O. package at the InterContinental Toronto Centre, which includes accommodations for two adults and two kids, selfie stick and sunblock on arrival, breakfast for all, popcorn-catered movie night, and “spa dollars.” From $229 per night. 
Grand Lucayan , The Bahamas 
Photo: Handout 
What’s better than spending $91 on a room in the tropics? Spending just $90 on one. That’s what it will run you at this 542-room classic and easy-to-reach playpen when you book now (and they’ll throw in a $125 resort credit, which seems mathematically challenged). It’s good for stays through Nov. 15, well before the Grand Lucayan births its all-inclusive enclave, Lighthouse Pointe, in December. Talk about cheap Labor!
